programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.sub-title: The Taj Mahal And The Golden Age Of Islam
programme.desc: Awe-inspiring palaces are the legacy that demonstrates the brilliance of Islamic engineers, working centuries before Western Europe began its own engineering revolution.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: As far back as the Bronze Age, humans were building ships capable of crossing oceans and trading between continents; perhaps the greatest surviving vessel from the Ancient world, is The Mary Rose, Henry VIII's mighty warship.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Examining the history of the Great Wall of China.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Temples, designed to honor the Gods, have been at the heart of cities since earliest times; often they have been the biggest and most impressive buildings of their age.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Without water, civilization is simply not possible; Romans took control of their water supplies very, very seriously; in order to keep the taps on, Roman engineers constructed vast networks of aqueducts, tunnels, sewers, and drains.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Hands-on participation in an ambitious project to translocate 100 elephants to repopulate some of Africa's depleted national parks.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Dr. Dave Gaynor conducts a natural experiment and introduces lions and cheetahs into the Zambezi Delta to look at the role apex predators play, prey and adapt in the ecosystem.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Hunter's dollars fund sheep conservation across the U.S. and the story is told through a hands-on translocation reestablishing historic home range for bighorn sheep.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Anti-poaching laws, community meat drops and upliftment initiatives are returning wildlife to the Zambezi Delta.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Understanding the history of bison populations in the U.S., and the current state of their protection, getting involved in collaring efforts in the Henry Mountains.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Giraffe Conservation Foundation is taking action across the continent to save the giraffe.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.sub-title: Quail: The Health of the Land
programme.desc: Quail populations in Texas are a crucial indicator species that are the canary in the coal mine for ecosystem health.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: The rescue and rehabilitation of orphaned chimpanzees from the bushmeat and pet trade in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Rhinos are threatened due to demand for their horns in Asia, so Ivan heads to the frontlines, where poaching events are a weekly occurrence, and explains conservation measures used to protect them.

programme.title: Defenders of the Wild
programme.desc: Human-wildlife conflict is prevalent across Africa, so to mitigate conflicts, Ivan joins Roger Whittall to collar bull elephants to create an early warning system for surrounding communities.
